column4: Can anyone tell me how to get sound back? I tried installing Open Sound System (OSS) which deletes ALSA and pulseaudio. Didn't help so I deleted OSS and reinstalled ALSA, but now I cannot see my volume bar. Not sure what to do from here.
do you have any external devices plugged into your sounc card?
have you checked the cables in the first place and see if the audio adapter jacks were mono or stereo?
Fairly certain this is not a hardware-related problem. The drivers are screwy or something because I'm able to have perfect sound in Windows.
OK. I am a Master Technician. I was just asking the usual questions.
What version are you using Desciero?
It sounds like the drivers are an issue or just plain a misconfiguration.
Have you tried seeing if your sound card or board is supported. In most respects, it is a generic board configuration that is what works.
I have an Intel A97. I believe it's supported.
do you get any noise or anything from the speakers?
Just ran this test and got sound: aplay /usr/share/sounds/alsa/Front_Center.wav
But my volume bar is nowhere to be found.
when you open up a .wav file try right clicking it to see if there is a properties adjustment.
Just checked and my card is supported. IT's the ICH5: http://www.alsa-project.org/main/index.php/Matrix:Vendor-Intel
